StormR 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Initialize a Storms object

    getStorms.Rd

    This function returns a Storms object that gathers all the storms specified by the user

    getStorms(
  sds = IBTRACS_SP,
  loi,
  seasons = c(1980, max(sds@database$seasons, na.rm = T)),
  names = NULL,
  max_dist = 300,
  remove_TD = TRUE,
  verbose = 2
)

    Arguments

    sds

    StormsDataset object. Default value is set to IBTRACS_SP which is a database provided by this package and based on the IBTrACS.SP.v04r00.nc file. The database must be previously loaded (See Details)

    loi

    Location of Interest. Must be either:

    • a SpatialPolygon (shapefile)

    • a sf object

    • a point of longitude/latitude coordinates provided in a numeric vector

    • a character representing a country (See Details section)

    seasons

    numeric vector. Should be either one or a range of calendar years. For cyclones that formed in one year and dissipated in the following year, the latter should be used

    names

    character vector. Names of storms. Default value is set to NULL.

    max_dist

    numeric. Indicates the buffer distance (in km) used to generate spatial.loi.buffer. Default value is set to 300km. This value also represents the maximum distance from the track of the storm where computations can be performed

    remove_TD

    logical. Whether or not to remove tropical depressions (< 18 m/s) and include cyclones only. Default value is set to TRUE.

    verbose

    numeric. Either 0, 1, 2 or 3. Whether or not the function must be verbose and display informations about the process, outputs, and additional notes

    • 0 Nothing is displayed

    • 1 Informations about the process are displayed

    • 2 Outputs are also displayed

    • 3 Additional notes to manipulate Storms objects are also displayed

    Default value is set to 2

    Value

    a Storms object that gathers all storms that match the criteria given in the inputs

    Examples

    #Focus on a single storm
pam <- getStorms(loi = "Vanuatu", names = "PAM")
#> === getStorms processing ... ===
#> 
#> -> Making buffer: Done
#> -> Searching for PAM storm ...
#>    -> Identifying Storms: Done
#> -> Gathering storm(s) ... 
#> 
  |                                                                            
  |                                                                      |   0%
  |                                                                            
  |======================================================================| 100%
#> 
#> === DONE with run time 1.617657 sec ===
#> 
#> SUMMARY:
#> (*) LOI: Vanuatu 
#> (*) Buffer size: 300 km
#> (*) Remove Tropical Depressions (< 18 m/s in sshs): yes
#> (*) Number of Storms: 1 
#>         Name - Tropical season - SSHS - Number of observation within buffer:
#>         PAM - 2015 - 5 - 20 
#> 

#Focus on several storms over New Caledonia
sts_nc <- getStorms(loi = "New Caledonia", names = c("ERICA","NIRAN"))
#> === getStorms processing ... ===
#> 
#> -> Making buffer: Done
#> -> Searching for ERICA NIRAN storms ...
#>    -> Identifying Storms: Done
#> -> Gathering storm(s) ... 
#> 
  |                                                                            
  |                                                                      |   0%
  |                                                                            
  |======================================================================| 100%
#> 
#> === DONE with run time 0.6511176 sec ===
#> 
#> SUMMARY:
#> (*) LOI: New Caledonia 
#> (*) Buffer size: 300 km
#> (*) Remove Tropical Depressions (< 18 m/s in sshs): yes
#> (*) Number of Storms: 2 
#>         Name - Tropical season - SSHS - Number of observation within buffer:
#>         ERICA - 2003 - 4 - 19 
#>         NIRAN - 2021 - 5 - 10 
#> 

#Focus on every storms that occured in the SP basin between 2010 and 2020
poly <- cbind(c(135, 290, 290, 135, 135),c(-60, -60, 0, 0, -60))
sp <- sf::st_polygon(list(poly))
sp <- sf::st_sfc(sp, crs = 4326)
sp <- sf::st_as_sf(sp)
sts_sp <- getStorms(loi = sp, seasons = c(2010,2020))
#> === getStorms processing ... ===
#> 
#> -> Making buffer: Done
#> -> Searching storms from 2010 to 2020 ...
#>    -> Identifying Storms: 91 potential candidates...
#> -> Gathering storm(s) ... 
#>
